posts.post_content: I can see it now. I have Lyzolda, the Blood Witch, [Savra, Queen of Golgari](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Savra, Queen of Golgari), and [Sprouting Thrinax](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sprouting Thrinax) on the field. I pay 2 and sacrfice the Thrinax. Then Lyzolda deals 2 damage to a creature or player, Each opponent sacrifices a creature to savra, I draw a card, and get three saprolings. All for 2 mana. My god I think I'm in love.

Posted By: Justice1337 (8/20/2011 8:56:27 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Man she is fun. Awesome for sacrificing [Murderous Redcap](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Murderous Redcap)s to make them persist and do even more damage. Some [Ashenmoor Liege](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ashenmoor Liege)s in your deck and the redcaps ability becomes very solid. Of course the card drawing is awesome as well - just make sure most of your creatures are RB and can be abused somehow by sacrificing them.  
  
Once you have sacrificed your redcap twice and it goes to the GY, just bring him back with [Torrent of Souls](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Torrent of Souls) and keep abusing him. At this point you have probably already have another redcap in your hand awaiting some treatment from Lyzolda. Not to mention, you should already have dealt a nice amount of damage to your opponent without even attacking.
posts.html:
Man she is fun. Awesome for sacrificing Murderous Redcaps to make them persist and do even more damage. Some Ashenmoor Lieges in your deck and the redcaps ability becomes very solid. Of course the card drawing is awesome as well - just make sure most of your creatures are RB and can be abused somehow by sacrificing them.

Once you have sacrificed your redcap twice and it goes to the GY, just bring him back with Torrent of Souls and keep abusing him. At this point you have probably already have another redcap in your hand awaiting some treatment from Lyzolda. Not to mention, you should already have dealt a nice amount of damage to your opponent without even attacking.

Posted By: 10meirij (8/4/2009 11:06:42 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
The only real downside I can see to her is her abysmal toughness.
  
   
That, and there's a glaring lack of abilities that let you put RB tokens into play in just those two colors, so to fully benefit from her ability you're pretty much forced to sacrfice nontoken creatures, which is an even bigger problem in Commander format unless you run cards like Splinter Twin.
posts.html:

That, and there's a glaring lack of abilities that let you put RB tokens into play in just those two colors, so to fully benefit from her ability you're pretty much forced to sacrfice nontoken creatures, which is an even bigger problem in Commander format unless you run cards like Splinter Twin.

Posted By: Neutralion (3/21/2010 9:34:06 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Laurelle, thanks for the great idea! :D  
  
R/B and B/G have both had pretty heavy sacrifice themes in the past and I've been attracted to what a Jund-FLAVORED deck would like mechanically for a while now. I now definitely am going to make a   
  
Savra/Lyzolda deck that casts *[Thromok the Insatiable](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Thromok the Insatiable)* to win! :D  
  
I have nothing against Bloodbraid Elf, but she's an Elf. I am always going to think of Elves as belonging to decks about life more than decks about death, unless they are {B}/x Elves, so Bloodbraid Elf just isn't what I think when I think of Jund. I know that sounds weird but it's the Vorthos in me. Bloodbraid Elf to me should be in a deck with Knight of New Alara.   
  
Jund is cool because it's kind of about life AND death, and just in general feels....'meaty'? But Bloodbraid Elf just isn't nearly black enough to belong as much as, say, [Ghave, Ghuru of Spores](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ghave, Ghuru of Spores) even though he's 'off-color'. Bloodbraid is like, PERFECT for Gruul though! :D
posts.html:
Laurelle, thanks for the great idea! :D

R/B and B/G have both had pretty heavy sacrifice themes in the past and I've been attracted to what a Jund-FLAVORED deck would like mechanically for a while now. I now definitely am going to make a

Savra/Lyzolda deck that casts Thromok the Insatiable to win! :D

I have nothing against Bloodbraid Elf, but she's an Elf. I am always going to think of Elves as belonging to decks about life more than decks about death, unless they are {B}/x Elves, so Bloodbraid Elf just isn't what I think when I think of Jund. I know that sounds weird but it's the Vorthos in me. Bloodbraid Elf to me should be in a deck with Knight of New Alara.

Jund is cool because it's kind of about life AND death, and just in general feels....'meaty'? But Bloodbraid Elf just isn't nearly black enough to belong as much as, say, Ghave, Ghuru of Spores even though he's 'off-color'. Bloodbraid is like, PERFECT for Gruul though! :D
